com.appfirst.statsd
Class AbstractStatsdClient

java.lang.Object
  com.appfirst.statsd.AbstractStatsdClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
StatsdClient
Direct Known Subclasses:
AFClient, UDPClient
public abstract class AbstractStatsdClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements StatsdClient

The Skeleton class of Java Statsd Client with AppFirst Extension.
Note: For best results, and greater availability, you'll probably want to create a wrapper class which creates a static client and proxies to it.
You know... the "Java way."
Based on Statsd Client of (C) 2011 Meetup, Inc. Author: Andrew Gwozdziewycz , @apgwoz

Author:
Yangming Huang @leonmax

Description copied from interface: StatsdClient
Send counter metrics with arbitrary magnitude. This one supports sampling.

Specified by:
updateStats in interface StatsdClient
Parameters:

                           java.lang.String message,
                           double sampleRate,
                           java.lang.String... buckets)

Send counter metrics with arbitrary magnitude. This one supports sampling and sending message (AppFirst Extension)

updateStats in interface StatsdClient

buckets - - The bucket name of the counter. You can send to more than one counter buckets with the same magnitude.
Returns:
True if success, False if fail to send stats.

doSend

protected abstract boolean doSend(java.lang.String stat)
To write a customized client, all you need is to implement this method which sends the stats message to StatsD Server thru your own media.

Parameters:
stat - - the formatted message ready to send to the StatsD Server.
Returns:
True if success, False otherwise.
